snippet: Requiring a password and a text-message code for entering Web sites would make hacking much more difficult.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column says Web sites can and should require two dissimilar things before access is granted; points out requiring a password and text-message code from a smartphone for entering sites would make hacking much more difficult.
lead_paragraph: Requiring a password and a text-message code for entering Web sites would make hacking much more difficult.

headline.seo: Two-Step Verification Is Inconvenient, but More Secure
headline.main: Doing the Two-Step, Beyond the A.T.M.
